image.altText: A man in a suit.

props.synopsis: Jake Sullivan was found guilty of raping an Australian Defence Force Academy colleague in Canberra in 2022.

title.children: Suspended army officer cadet jailed for raping ADFA colleague

image.altText: a composite image of bradfield candidates Liberal Gisele Kapterian and independent Nicolette Boele

props.synopsis: The seat of Bradfield was won by just 26 votes. Now the defeated Liberal candidate has lodged a High Court appeal over 150 ballot papers that, she claims, could swing the result.

title.children: Defeated Liberal candidate petitions High Court on election outcome

image.altText: A young solider.

props.synopsis: Private Richard Norden has received the Victoria Cross for bravery in the face of enemy fire, 57 years after his death.

title.children: Soldier receives Australia's highest military honour 53 years after death

image.altText: A man.

props.synopsis: Inmate Dillon Mitcherson has been charged after authorities located him at a service station near the Cooma Correctional Centre in the early hours of Wednesday morning.

title.children: Inmate charged with escaping from Cooma prison

image.altText: Birds fly out the front of Parliament House

props.synopsis: With the newly elected federal government set to return to parliament next week, what can ACT residents expect from it over the next three years?Â

title.children: What the federal government has on the docket for Canberra

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair and a red scarf stands outdoors smiling lightly.

props.synopsis: Amalia Vatavalis was undergoing chemotherapy for cancer when her mother died from a brain tumour. When she asked her strata manager for a hardship payment plan for her body corporate fees, they rejected the idea.Â

title.children: Amalia was having chemo when her mum died. Her strata didn't listen

image.altText: A black-and-white still of a hatchback seen through tree branches

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old man is cleared of all charges related to the shooting of a rival at Oaks Estate last year after the judge is unable to rule out beyond reasonable doubt that the shooter wasn't another man.

title.children: Man cleared of all charges over Oaks Estate shooting

image.altText: A van with its nose wedged into a snowdrift on the side of a road.

props.synopsis: Visitors to NSW ski resorts are being reminded to drive to the conditions after more than 100 instances of cars sliding off the roads this winter.

title.children: Warning to drivers amid fourfold increase in snow-related crashes

image.altText: A burnt out fire place.

props.synopsis: More than five years after being destroyed by the Black Summer bushfires, two heritage huts in the ACT's Namadgi National Park remain burnt-out, fenced-off ruins, despite government promises to build two new structures in remembrance of them.

title.children: The government promised to rebuild, but these huts remain in ruins

image.altText: Two soldiers on the ground in camoflauge firing a Carl Gustaf weapon.

props.synopsis: This weapon that has been fired by decades of Australian soldiers may have been causing damage to their brains.

title.children: Watch what happens when ADF soldiers fire the Carl Gustaf recoilless rifle

image.altText: Two men in navy suits and one uniformed police officer stand behind a bald man as he steps up into the back of a police van.

props.synopsis: A Sydney man who says he chases "crooks and their crooks" is denied bail in the ACT Magistrates Court, amid allegations about a stolen safe containing nearly $1 million in gold bullion, coins and ammunition.

title.children: 'Crook' chaser denied bail over allegations related to gold safe retrieval

image.altText: U.S. President Donald Trump holds up a chart with numbers showing tax rates changed to trading partners

props.synopsis: Maybe the best way to comprehend just how genuinely chaotic these intersecting systems have become is to stop trying to think about them at a country-by-country level, and just pick a product: lobsters.Â

title.children: How lobsters hold the key to understanding Trump's trade chaos

image.altText: Ken Henry stands behind a black and wooden podium, looking down

props.synopsis: Australia's environment protection laws have both failed to stop the degradation of nature and also held back economic growth, former Treasury secretary Ken Henry warns.

title.children: Ken Henry calls for urgent environmental protection overhaul

image.altText: A female judge is walking with two Torres Strait Islander men in black suits beside her and a group of media facing them

props.synopsis: After a federal court judge found Torres Strait Islanders will likely become "climate refugees" without urgent action, the two traditional owners at the heart of the case invite the prime minister to their islands to witness the impacts firsthand.

title.children: 'We are sinking': Torres Strait Islanders vow not to give up climate fight

image.altText: A woman reads a book to children.

props.synopsis: A University of Sydney-led paper undertook Australia's first peer-targeted study of unpaid work for childcare workers, amid a crisis of confidence across the sector.

title.children: Childcare workers struggling to care for children over 'non-contact' tasks

image.altText: John Torode wearing a tuxedo holding a fork of spaghetti

props.synopsis: The Australian-born celebrity chef has denied the allegation, which the BBC says was substantiated in an investigation into his co-host Greg Wallace's behaviour on set.Â

title.children: Australian host of UK Masterchef John Torode sacked over racist language

image.altText: Donald Trump and Gianni Infantino in blue suits peering over the golden FIFA Club World Cup trophy on the Oval Office desk

props.synopsis: Despite FIFA's claims the Club World Cup was "a world-class stage", it faced significant challenges that could also impact the 2026 World Cup in a country governed by the uncertainty of Donald Trump.

title.children: Empty seats and big delays mean the World Cup may trouble Trump's USA

image.altText: A chart tracks stock market lower

props.synopsis: The local share market pulls back after hitting fresh records, and the fastest rise in US inflation since January hits Wall Street stocks. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Broad-based fall pulls ASX off record high as mining stocks drag

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Rare earth miners rally as US supply deals boost sentiment
Meta shareholders vs Zuckerberg in $US8 billion lawsuit
ASX sinks, dragged down by miners

image.altText: A young girl staring blankly at a camera.

props.synopsis: It's a blank, expressionless look often given by the younger generation in service roles. But experts explain there is a reason why this trend is emerging.Â

title.children: The gen Z stare is going viral. Here's what it is

image.altText: June looks to the right of the camera while wearing the white handmaid bonnet and red cape.

props.synopsis: From Elizabeth Moss's Handmaid's Tale snub to Adolescence breaking records, here's what you need to know about the 2025 Emmy nominations.

title.children: Elizabeth Moss snubbed for final Handmaid's Tale and other Emmy shocks

image.altText: A green matcha latte in a black mug with rosetta latte art.

props.synopsis: From traditional tea ceremonies to viral TikToks, the rising popularity of matcha is driving a global shortage, leaving farmers, suppliers and cafes trying to keep up.

title.children: Tea farmers 'cannot cope' as matcha demand surges

image.altText: A pig with a dark background behind it.

props.synopsis: Footage taken by an activist group allegedly in a piggery north of Adelaide shows pigs feeding on carcasses, some belonging to other pigs. WARNING: this story contains graphic content that may distress readers.

title.children: Cannibalism footage sparks animal welfare investigation at SA piggery

image.altText: Dakota at 9 years old smiles happily in a girl guides uniform.

props.synopsis:
A woman who spent time in residential care as a child and a long-time foster carer say support workers with lived experience and more help for foster carers are needed, ahead of an inquiry into Queensland's child safety system.
Â 
Â

title.children: 'Scary' child safety system in spotlight ahead of Queensland inquiry

image.altText: A side-by-side image shows young German woman Carolina Wilga and Aboriginal man Clinton Lockyer

props.synopsis: The miraculous survival of German backpacker Carolina Wilga in the West Australian outback was met with joy and relief across the country. But for families of missing Aboriginal men who are still searching for answers, it's prompted uncomfortable questions.

title.children: Why do we care about some people who go missing, but ignore others?

image.altText: Jim Chalmers, wearing a thoughtful expression, stands in front of a dark background.

props.synopsis: Treasury's mistaken release of advice that "tax should be raised" looks like a happy accident for a treasurer determined for major reform.

title.children: A happy accident? Tax reform talk heats up after Treasury's FOI error

image.altText: A young man with curly blonde hair wears an apron and holds his arms up to display his biceps.

props.synopsis: The mother of a 21-year-old footballer who died in 2023 has told a court how her son's condition quickly declined the day after he suffered a head injury.

title.children: Mother of young footballer tells inquest of rapid decline after mystery injury

image.altText: A whale's tail peaking out of the surface of the water, with boats in the background in the harbour.

props.synopsis: Sydney ferry passengers on their morning commute were greeted by a humpback whale, which entered the harbour around 8am on Wednesday.

title.children: Whale spotted in Sydney Harbour, ferries paused on morning commute

image.altText: A brunette woman sits on a desk while leaning on a fireplace.

props.synopsis: The mushroom murder trial has exposed our ravenous appetite for true-crime content, but what does it mean for the criminal defence lawyers working within the system?

title.children: Being a criminal defence lawyer in the age of trial by entertainment

image.altText: SANFL and Australian rules football legend Barrie Robran.

props.synopsis: Australian rules football champion and Hall of Fame legend Barrie Robran is being remembered as "an icon, a mentor, and a true gentleman" following his death at the age of 77.

title.children: Australian rules football legend Barrie Robran dies aged 77

image.altText: Xi Jinping in a navy suit and red tie clapping his hands and smiling slightly

props.synopsis: Pew Research Centre's latest survey of 24 countries found that opinion towards the US and its president, Donald Trump, had deteriorated, while views of China and its president had improved.

title.children: Australians now favour economic ties with China over the US, survey finds

image.altText: people standing by lake

props.synopsis: Jaye Lee Walton, 42, did not appear in person as the manslaughter charge was mentioned.

title.children: Father charged with manslaughter of seven-month-old baby boy, in custody

image.altText: a man in a hat standing in front of a tree

props.synopsis: A group of Australia's top environmental scientists calls for changes to prescribed burning after government documents confirm hundreds of trees in an ecological hotspot have been destroyed by a government-lit fire.

title.children: Top scientists sound alarm over damage caused by prescribed burns

image.altText: A woman with dark wavy hair in the backyard of a house.

props.synopsis: At 42, Amna did not want to join a share house or spend all her money on rent. She turned to house-sitting to save a deposit. Â Â

title.children: How I avoided paying rent for 18 months to save for a house deposit

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a cap and hoodie sits next to a shelf with a photo of a smiling teenager and a candle on it.

props.synopsis: The remains of Charlie Gander were found in a burnt-out car in northern Victoria in 2022. Charlie's dad, Richard, says he is devastated that only one of the three people tried has been found guilty of murder.

title.children: Father of murdered teenager 'shattered' by Supreme Court jury verdict

image.altText: Barbies sit on the shelf of a department store

props.synopsis: The US president announces the agreement on his social media platform but provides no further details on the deal.

title.children: Trump says trade deal with Indonesia 'great deal, for everybody'
